name: Renaissance ClubSport Walnut Creek Hotel

reviews.text: Room decor is cheerful with modern designer touch. Beds comfortable and welcoming with fluffy comforter and pillows. Quiet. Room darkening draperies that really keep out the light !
reviews.title: Spectacular

reviews.text: Because it was raining, we chose to try the restaurant, C-Blue for both dinner and breakfast. Excellent! Service attentive, menu imaginative . We were reluctant to try based on some reviews and had it not been raining, we would never have experienced C-Blue. Both the hotel and restaurant exceeded our expectations !
reviews.title: Great hotel with amazing amenities

reviews.text: We did not have time to try the Sports Club, but it appeared to be state of the art and well attended.
reviews.title: Customer service is #1!!!

reviews.text: Stayed here for two
reviews.title: Contemporary hotel close to miles of biking trails in a suburban location.
Great Service in a Fun & Fit Environment!
reviews.text: nights used valet parking both nights- great room, clean, great cable options like hbo, cute little decor-- you could even ask for a fridge to be brought up and put in your room. I intended to use their workout facilities as it also has an impressive gym- but I didn't get around to it ;) I did think the staff was very friendly- valet was 24 hours which is great if your out late in sf. /would recommend and would stay again! Their is also a very very very good tempan suishi place called Kobe in walnut creek that was delicious, entertaining, reasonably priced-
We stayed one night at this hotel on points. The service was great, and the room was very comfortable and clean. The soap provided was fantastic; lived up to the "spa" hype.
reviews.title: Great fitness program, very commercial

reviews.text: I only walked through the gym, but it looked excellent. They had what seemed to be a full-length outdoor lap pool. Also, I was given a list of programs included in the stay (unfortunately as I was leaving so I couldn't take advantage of any of them) and it was very extensive.
reviews.title: Unimpressed.

reviews.text: The only downside is that with the great fitness center, a lot of people not staying at the hotel were constantly milling around. Also, it had a very commercial feel to it, which isn't exactly what I'm looking for when I'm staying at a hotel.
reviews.title: disappointed

reviews.text: High rates. No safe in room. No movies in room. Small rooms - no sitting area. They asked what newspaper to deliver to my room each morning. I was impressed that I had a choice. I told them my preference but they didn't deliver it. I was there four nights. I called front desk at least four times because the WiFi was down. My duvet sheet was torn in three places - poor form! They replaced it and lowered my room rates. Parking was $19 @ day. The good news is that the sports club and restaurant are outstanding! Also - the woman at the front desk who served as my advocate for problem solving - and there were many occasions - deserves huge kudos. She was great!
reviews.title: Gym and Breakfast are great!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Came for an evening of in-room movies and girlfriend chatter. No in-room movies (even though website touts them), mandatory valet-parking (all other hotels in area have self-parking), cleaning lady woke us up at 8:00 a.m. (probably could've avoided if we'd put sign on door), and a couple other little annoyances not worth mentioning. So, while the room was nice, the gym at the hotel is terrific and the food in the bistro was good enough, the website misled us and we were disappointed. Won't be back. We live in the area and will definitely choose the Lafayette Park Hotel next time!
reviews.title: Great hotel for our stopover

reviews.text: Pros:
reviews.title: Great sports club and spa

reviews.text: - Nice, clean rooms
reviews.title: Nice Hotel!!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - Very large bath tubs.
reviews.title: Excellent service and nice amenities

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - Complimentary use of the hotel's gym and swimming pools
reviews.title: Fit the bill ....one-night get-away!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - Nice gift shop and spa
reviews.title: Very nice hotel and convenient too

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a really good experience here after a few initial snafus.
reviews.title: Good experience overall

reviews.text: When we first checked in, I had trouble accessing the room with my key card. Well, it turns out that the room was already occupied. It turns out the clerk at the front desk had entered the wrong room number, since she had been juggling customers. Then the room she sent us to had two doubles (no big deal, but we'd booked a king room). She switched us to a king room and compensated us for the aggravation with free breakfasts during our stay. We all have those sort of days; she definitely made up for the mistakes.
reviews.title: MY FAVORITE HOTEL!

reviews.text: The room was decent sized, as was the bathroom. The bed, as with most chains nowadays, had a super comfortable mattress. I'm sorry we didn't have time to take advantage of the athletic facilities while we were there. Given the level of service and the sporting amenities, this place was a really good deal. If we come back to visit San Francisco, I'll consider booking here. It was more than half the price of our San Francisco lodging. The only real downside I saw was the parking fee -- I prefer to self-park and paying for parking is one of my pet peeves. However, it seems to be the norm in this area.
reviews.title: Good deal

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed here for three weeks back in 2003 and have been hoping to come back ever since. This place is pretty much perfect.
reviews.title: Highly Recommend

reviews.text: First off, I love the way it looks. It has a hip, modern feel and great care was put into every last corner of it. The rooms are spacious and extremely well-appointed. (Even free bottles of water which I really appreciated.) There is free internet -- and not even the kind where you have to enter a password or give personal information. Just push connect, and boom, you're on.
reviews.title: Nice gym with hotel attached

description: Discover a leader among hotels in Walnut Creek, CA at the Renaissance ClubSport, where a unique blend of full-service accommodations with a world-class sports club, creates a superb spa-style fitness resort and luxury hotel in suburban Walnut Creek. Guests can enjoy complimentary access to the 85,000 square foot ClubSport fitness center, offering the latest cardio and strength training equipment, five group fitness studios, racquetball, handball ans squash courts, an aquatic center and childcare center with activities for kids of all ages. Guests at our Walnut Creek hotel can also indulge in fine cuisine and beverages at our C-Blue Wet Bar and Bistro, or be pampered at R-Spa, our luxurious day spa. Complimentary high-speed internet access is also available throughout our Walnut Creek, California hotel's luxurious property. Located just 30 minutes from San Francisco and Napa Valley, this centrally located hotel in Walnut Creek is sure to provide all the accommodations and amenities you need for a spa weekend.
